title: Amid opt-out rumors, Sam Kennedy says Alex Bregman ‘wants to be here’ with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman may opt out of his Red Sox contract at the end of the 2025 season.
Sam Kennedy states Bregman and the Red Sox are focused on securing a playoff spot, not future contracts.
Bregman has recorded a .279 average with 16 home runs and 57 RBIs over 101 games this season.

title: Bill Belichick says in new book that Tom Brady made ‘right decision’ to leave Patriots in 2020
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Tom Brady left the Patriots in 2020, with Bill Belichick saying he made the right decision in a new book.
Belichick stated the Patriots were in an 'impossible situation' due to financial constraints and poor roster talent.
Brady's relationship with Belichick and the Patriots' declining performance contributed to his departure.

title: West Boylston town administrator fired after Trump flag dispute sues town
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: James Ryan sues West Boylston for $1.3 million after termination following dispute over a Trump flag with Police Chief Minnich.
Ryan alleges wrongful termination, citing his obligation to uphold ethics laws against political activity on public property.
Police Chief Minnich, angry over flag inspection, filed a complaint against Ryan, leading to Ryan's firing by a 4-1 vote.

title: 18-year-old injured in R.I. after lighting himself on fire for TikTok challenge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An 18-year-old was hospitalized in North Smithfield, R.I., after attempting a TikTok fire challenge with a friend.
The challenge involved setting themselves on fire and jumping from a railroad trestle into Slatersville Reservoir.
The teen suffered second- and third-degree burns; no charges were filed for trespassing on the private property.

title: ‘Fear and uncertainty’: Everett officials cancel Hispanic Heritage Month festival amid ICE crackdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Everett officials canceled the Sept. 20 Fiesta Del Rio festival due to recent ICE raids causing community fear.
The Fiesta Del Rio celebrates Hispanic culture with music, art, and food, and was set for Rivergreen Park.
Mayor Carlo DeMaria stated the event's cancellation is to protect community members who may feel unsafe.

title: Josh Kraft ends mayoral campaign after coming in second by nearly 50 points in Tuesday’s preliminary
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Josh Kraft ends his Boston mayoral campaign after a major defeat by Mayor Michelle Wu in the preliminary election.
Wu outperformed Kraft by nearly 50 points, with unofficial results showing a margin of over 45,000 votes.
Kraft plans to donate $3 million to address local humanitarian issues after dropping out of the race.

title: Josh McDaniels defends Drake Maye: ‘He’s the right guy’ for Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Josh McDaniels defends quarterback Drake Maye, advocating for a long-term vision and growth despite initial struggles.
Maye struggled in the second half of the Patriots' Week 1 loss to the Raiders, prompting media criticism.
McDaniels emphasizes Maye logging more NFL snaps, planning to ease pressure with a balanced offensive approach.

title: Authorities in a Connecticut town want to speak with whoever is painting the squirrels
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: East Hartford Animal Control reports two squirrels were painted red and blue near Naubuc Avenue and High Street.
The squirrels seem uninjured; Animal Control collaborates with a wildlife rehabilitator for appropriate care.
Authorities seek public help to identify who painted the squirrels and request information at 860-291-7572.

title: 2 Mass. teachers reportedly on leave for reactions to Charlie Kirk’s death
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Two Massachusetts teachers placed on leave for social media reactions to Charlie Kirk's shooting death.
Wachusett and Framingham districts confirmed staffing changes, with police presence at schools as precaution.
Charlie Kirk, 31, was shot at a Utah college event; FBI investigates as a targeted attack.

title: A top return from Bruins’ roster teardown, prospect Fraser Minten is looking to stick in NHL
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten, a key acquisition in Boston Bruins' 2025 roster overhaul, aims for an NHL roster spot this season.
The Bruins acquired Minten, a young forward, and draft picks from Toronto in exchange for Brandon Carlo.
Minten played 25 NHL games between Boston and Toronto, showcasing a versatile skill set focused on reliability.
